title: What are some famous monuments in England? - Quora

response.answer_text: Stone circles such as Stonehenge, Avebury, callanish and many more, together with a variety of assorted Neolithic hengesvand buriel mounds. Want more modern, a lot of cities with “Chester" in their name will still have sections of Roman wall, Roman bath houses and excavated villas (there's even a big wall running across the country in the north) There are Celtic crosses addorning areas of the countryside and look closely and there are mediaeval buildings. Then there are castles galore from all ages and stately homes. Want more modern? The Monument to the great fire of London. Even more modern? Various monuments to the first and second world wars Contemporary? We do that too. The Diana Princess of Wales fountain, angel of the north etc. Britain has a long and extensive history much of which has survived largely intact for thousands of years. Just look and it's laid out in plain sight

Here is the list of some best monuments in England: 1. Buckingham Palace, London  2. Stonehenge, Wiltshire  3. Tower Bridge, London  4. Blackpool Tower, Blackpool 5. St Paul’s Cathedral, London 6. Edinburgh Castle, Edinburgh Source: Famous Monuments in England | Most Visited Monuments in England
